TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 983
TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to Samuel M Williams, 05-31-1833

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to Samuel M. Williams, Matamoros, May 31, 1833. Reporting conditions of his journey. George Fisher returning to Texas as tariff officer. Instructions concerning land at foot of the mountains
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 983

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Samuel M. Williams, Matamoros, May 31, 1833. Reporting conditions of his journey. George Fisher returning to Texas as tariff officer. Instructions concerning land at foot of the mountains.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*[From Williams Papers, Rosenberg Library, Galveston, Tex.]*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Matamoros */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="05-31-1833">May 31. 1833*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr Sir, I have unexpectedly met with a passage to *location_mentioned*Vera Cruz*/location_mentioned* and sail *date_mentioned n="06-01-1833">tomorrow*/date_mentioned*—the trip by land would have been severe on me at this hot season and I am rather weak from a dysentery—tho it is getting better. I refer you to my letter to the *person_mentioned*Ayto*/person_mentioned*. as to news etc.—all goes well here now, but a darker squall than seemed to be gathering when I arrived, I have not seen lately. The prospects are all changed and they now are bright. *person_mentioned*Fisher */person_mentioned*is reappointed and goes on soon with only a few *person_mentioned*troops*/person_mentioned*. I expect he will go by land through *location_mentioned*San Felipe*/location_mentioned*, and I particularly recommend that the past be forgotten—he is an*person_mentioned* officer of the Govt*/person_mentioned*, and he will now get on very well and be usefull to *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*—of this I have no doubt*/p*.
*p*I hope you will have the *location_mentioned*office */location_mentioned*business attended to and the surveys regulated and all other matters—also the title for *location_mentioned*the tract that Brown Surveyed at the foot of the mountains east side of Colorado*/location_mentioned*—both the ones on the other side can be taken by *person_mentioned*Valle*/person_mentioned* or not just as you please.*/p*
*p*Write me to *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*, care of *person_mentioned*Wm. S. Parrott*/person_mentioned* so that he can take out the letters and keep them untill I arrive.*/p*
*p*remember me to *person_mentioned*Mrs. Williams*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr S. M. Williams*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Mr. Brown*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
